intro: Staurogyne parvicaulis, commonly known as the small-leaved starwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in aquatic gardens.
